meanings.definition: Attracting or tempting someone to do something
meanings.sent1: The luring aroma of freshly baked cookies filled the kitchen.
meanings.sent2: The bright colors of the candy were luring children to the store.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel used a luring dance to trick the other animals.
meanings.sent4: The mysterious stranger had a luring smile that captivated everyone.
meanings.sent5: The sparkling jewels in the display case had a luring effect on passersby.

meanings.definition: The act of enticing or drawing someone in
meanings.sent1: The luring of customers with special discounts was successful.
meanings.sent2: The fisherman used a shiny lure for luring fish in the lake.
meanings.sent3: The magician's luring of the audience into his tricks amazed everyone.
meanings.sent4: The luring of unsuspecting travelers into the haunted house was a spooky sight.
meanings.sent5: The luring of birds with birdseed made the backyard a lively place.
